clinical_study.brief_title: Periodontal Therapy on the Gut Microbiome of Inflammatory Bowel Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Intensive or Conventional Periodontal Therapy on the Gut Microbiome and Systemic Inflammation of Patients With Inflammatory Bowel Disease: a Single-blinded Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Periodontitis and inflammatory bowel disease have been associated by meta-epidemiologic evidence, although their mechanistic connection needs to be further explored. Oral-gut axis is implicated in the pathogenesis of several chronic inflammatory conditions, but to date no studies have evaluated the impact of periodontal treatment on gut ecology. Thus, the present randomised clinical trial is aimed at investigating the effect of intensive or conventional periodontal therapy on the gut microbiome and parameters of systemic inflammation of patients diagnosed with inflammatory bowel disease.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in microbiome alpha diversity measured from stool samples at 3 months
primary_outcome.description: Taxonomic and functional variation of gut bacteria after treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in microbiome alpha diversity measured from saliva samples at 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Taxonomic and functional variation of salivary bacteria after treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of the inflammatory markers levels in plasma
secondary_outcome.description: Concentration of cytokines and biomarkers in plasma samples

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in mean clinical attachment level (CAL) at 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Variation in CAL after therapy assessed using a millimetre marked manual periodontal probe at 6 sites per tooth element

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in periodontal pocket depth (PPD) at 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Variation in PPD after therapy assessed using a millimetre marked manual periodontal probe at 6 sites per tooth element

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in full mouth bleeding score (FMBS) at 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Variation in the percentage of bleeding sites after therapy assessed by gentle probing at 6 sites per tooth element

arm_group.description: Adjunctive full-mouth intensive removal of subgingival dental plaque biofilms with the use of scaling and root planing after the administration of local anesthesia.
Standard cycle of supragingival mechanical scaling and polishing.

intervention.intervention_name: Full mouth scaling and root planing (FMSRP)
intervention.description: Subgingival instrumentation with ultrasonic devices and curettes of all periodontal pockets completed within 48 hours

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- clinical and instrumental diagnosis of ulcerative colitis or Crohn's disease
- periodontitis Stage III or IV
- BMI between 20 and 29 kg/m2
- free diet
- presence of at least 20 teeth
Exclusion Criteria:
- Systemic diseases (including diabetes, thyroid, liver, or kidney diseases)
- dietary allergies
- use of antibiotics or probiotics during the previous 30 days
- pregnancy or breast feeding
